result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickey Harris Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nickey Harris Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nickey Harris Jr. was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency regarding his children.   DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty James Fields-Bowers.  Warrant vacated; bond reinstated.  Case is resolved. Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  Request for expunction is denied.
